hints.content:
There are $\blueD{8}$ groups with $\maroonD{2}$ triangles each.

![8 groups of 2 triangles](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8c5f479c236d877bec243597867a3be9d43d45cf)

The expression $\blueD{8} \times \maroonD{2}$ represents the picture.

There are $16$ total triangles.

We can rearrange those same $16$ triangles to show $\maroonD{2}$ groups with $\blueD{8}$ triangles in each.

![2 groups of 8 triangles](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/97de0741c521e66fbf9905af16331426fe2b91d9)

The expression $\maroonD{2} \times \blueD{8}$ also represents the picture.

[[☃ explanation 1]]
We can represent the picture with the expressions $\blueD{8} \times \maroonD{2}$ and $\maroonD{2} \times \blueD{8}$.

question.content:
**Which two expressions represent the following picture?**

![8 groups of 2 triangles](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8c5f479c236d877bec243597867a3be9d43d45cf)

[[☃ radio 1]]
